decks.notes: The main strategy of this deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and card draw. By using cards like Counterspell and Snuff Out, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while being able to draw more cards with Brainstorm and Preordain. Additionally, cards like Spellstutter Sprite and Faerie Seer provide some board presence and tempo advantage. The inclusion of Murmuring Mystic and Thorn of the Black Rose offers additional win conditions and card advantage. Overall, the deck's goal is to outlast and outvalue the opponent through efficient control tactics.

The main concept of this deck is to build a strong defense using walls such as Axebane Guardian and Overgrown Battlement while also utilizing combo pieces like Freed from the Real and Galvanic Alchemist to generate infinite mana. Lead the Stampede helps to dig for combo pieces while Saruli Caretaker and Generous Ent provide additional support. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful finisher like Valakut Invoker. Overall, the strategy revolves around creating a wall of defense while setting up a game-winning combo.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures and then using reanimation spells like Dread Return and Exhume to bring powerful creatures like Lotleth Giant and Troll of Khazad-dûm back into play. Cards like Stinkweed Imp help with graveyard filling, while Gnaw to the Bone can help gain life against aggressive opponents. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures early in the game, using the combo of creatures and reanimation spells to create a powerful board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of elf creatures, utilizing cards like Priest of Titania and Quirion Ranger to generate mana quickly and play multiple elves each turn. Cards like Lead the Stampede and Distant Melody help to refuel the hand with more creatures, while Timberwatch Elf can buff them up to deal massive damage. The deck also includes some defensive options like Wellwisher and Vines of Vastwood to protect the elves and maintain board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of Gates and various spells like Counterspell, Lightning Bolt, and Destroy Evil. The deck utilizes Archaeomancer to recur important spells and creatures, while also employing defensive creatures like Guardian of the Guildpact and Stonehorn Dignitary to stall the opponent. Ephemerate is used to protect important creatures and generate value. The deck aims to maintain board control by utilizing a mix of removal spells and efficient creatures to outvalue the opponent.

The main focus of this mono black aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with low-cost creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Nameless Inversion and Ghoulcaller's Chant, the deck aims to control the board and continuously apply pressure with creatures like Shambling Ghast, Putrid Goblin, and Carrion Feeder. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Foul-Tongue Shriek and Gempalm Polluter to deal direct damage to the opponent. The overall strategy is to quickly build a threatening board presence and attack aggressively to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to create a powerful combo utilizing cards like Prologue to Phyresis and Contentious Plan to generate poison counters on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Weather the Storm to gain life and survive longer, while also having cards like Thirsting Roots to ramp up mana production. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a storm of poison counters and control the game through various resource management cards like Pentad Prism and Vivisurgeon's Insight.

The main concept of this deck is to abuse the Flicker and combo mechanics to create value and control the game. The deck focuses on using creatures with powerful "enter the battlefield" effects like Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer, and spells like Ephemerate and Ghostly Flicker to continuously flicker and reuse these abilities. By generating card advantage, controlling the board, and gaining life with cards like God-Pharaoh's Faithful, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponent in a game of attrition while setting up for big plays and combos.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using low-cost, efficient spells and creatures. With a strong emphasis on lifelink cards like Vampire's Kiss and Sovereign's Bite, as well as direct damage spells like Bump in the Night and Soul Reap, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and drain their life total while maintaining card advantage with Sign in Blood. By utilizing the synergy between cheap creatures like Serrated Scorpion and removal spells like Hopeless Nightmare, the deck can maintain board presence and close out the game rapidly.

This deck focuses on utilizing gates and control spells to restrict the opponent's options while setting up a strong board presence. By managing resources efficiently with counterspells and removal like Journey to Nowhere, the deck aims to establish a dominant position on the battlefield. Squadron Hawk and Sacred Cat provide early blockers and card advantage, while Lórien Revealed and Guardian of the Guildpact offer additional protection. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and win through efficient use of gates and powerful creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countering opponent's spells, removal effects, and card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while efficiently getting creatures onto the battlefield and overwhelming the opponent with card advantage. The deck utilizes a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own threats. It focuses on efficient spells and efficient creatures to generate advantage and maintain control of the game.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost creatures and using burn spells to deal direct damage to the opponent. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards like Goblin Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary to quickly build a board presence. Cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide help provide mana acceleration, allowing the deck to play multiple spells in a single turn. The deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cheap spells and card draw, the deck aims to maintain a high level of tempo and pressure to outpace the opponent. With a low land count and a strong emphasis on instant speed interaction, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own board presence. The inclusion of cards like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent further emphasize the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost artifacts and creatures to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a high-powered attack. By utilizing cards that benefit from having multiple artifacts in play, such as All That Glitters and Myr Enforcer, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to establish their own game plan. Additionally, cards like Metallic Rebuke and Thoughtcast provide utility and card advantage to help maintain tempo and outpace the opponent.
